feedback noun [U]
(MACHINE)
the sudden, high, unpleasant noise sometimes produced by an amplifier when sound it produces is put back into it: Jimi Hendrix loved to fling his guitar around to get weird and wonderful sounds from the feedback.
engineering
  specialized the return back into a machine or system of part of what it produces, especially to improve what is produced: feedback from Feedback from the sensors ensures that the car engine runs smoothly.
